triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses a fundamental challenge in offline reinforcement learning by proposing a conservative approach to Q-function learning.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: CQL is a novel variant of Q-learning that learns conservative Q-functions to handle distributional shift in offline settings.

triples.name: Offline learning
triples.relevance: The paper directly addresses the problem of learning effective policies from fixed datasets without further environment interaction.

triples.name: Actor-critic algorithm
triples.relevance: CQL can be incorporated into actor-critic implementations to improve policy learning in offline settings.

triples.name: Bellman equation
triples.relevance: The Bellman error objective is a core component of CQL's Q-function regularization approach.

triples.name: Policy gradient method
triples.relevance: CQL incorporates policy learning procedures that benefit from Q-function lower bounds for improved gradient estimates.

triples.name: Domain adaptation
triples.relevance: The distributional shift challenge addressed by CQL is a key problem in domain adaptation between datasets and learned policies.
